abstract: Federal prosecutors have accused Mathew Martoma of making more than $276 million in a combination of illegal profits and avoided losses trading in the shares of the pharmaceutical companies Elan and Wyeth.
snippet: Federal prosecutors have accused Mathew Martoma of making more than $276 million in a combination of illegal profits and avoided losses trading in the shares of the pharmaceutical companies Elan and Wyeth.
lead_paragraph: Mathew Martoma, the former portfolio manager at SAC Capital Advisors, is set to stand trial on Nov. 4, almost a year after federal authorities charged him in what they called the largest insider trading case ever brought.

headline.main: Trial Date Set for Former SAC Trader in Insider Case
